title: Percentage Discount Calculator
description: Calculate the final price after a percentage discount.
intro: Determine the sale price after applying a percentage discount. Enter the original amount and the discount percent to see the reduced price.

faqs.question: Can I enter decimal prices?
faqs.answer: Yes, the calculator accepts cents and fractional percentages.

faqs.question: What if the discount is 0%?
faqs.answer: The final price equals the original price.

faqs.question: How do I find the discount amount?
faqs.answer: Subtract the final price from the original price.

faqs.question: What happens with discounts over 100%?
faqs.answer: A percentage above 100% results in a negative price, which isn't realistic.

info: Outputs the sale price only; taxes, shipping, or additional fees are not included.
Ideal for comparing promotional offers to determine the best deal quickly.

title: Simple Interest Calculator
description: Compute simple interest based on principal, rate and time.

faqs.question: Is compounding included?
faqs.answer: No. Use a compound interest calculator for compounding.

faqs.question: How is the interest calculated?
faqs.answer: Interest equals principal multiplied by rate and time in years.

faqs.question: Can I use months instead of years?
faqs.answer: Convert months to years by dividing by 12 before calculating.

faqs.question: Does the result include the principal?
faqs.answer: No, it returns only the interest earned.

info: Uses the basic simple-interest formula where interest grows linearly and any earned interest isn't reinvested.
Best suited for quick projections on short-term loans or investments that don't compound.

title: Compound Interest Calculator
description: Compute the future value using compound interest.
intro: Compound interest grows your money by applying interest on both the principal and the interest already earned. Enter the principal, annual rate, compounding frequency, and years to see the future value.

faqs.question: What is compound interest?
faqs.answer: Interest calculated on both the initial principal and accumulated interest.

faqs.question: How do I choose compounding frequency?
faqs.answer: Use how often interest is added per year, such as 12 for monthly or 4 for quarterly.

faqs.question: What if rate or years is zero?
faqs.answer: The future value equals the principal since no interest accrues.

faqs.question: Does this assume reinvestment of interest?
faqs.answer: Yes, all interest is reinvested each period.

info: Assumes interest is reinvested at the stated rate and frequency.
Doesn't account for taxes, fees, or additional contributions.

title: BMI Calculator
description: Compute Body Mass Index from weight and height to assess weight status.
intro: Compute BMI using metric units of weight and height to evaluate body mass.

faqs.question: What is BMI?
faqs.answer: BMI is a ratio of weight to height used to classify weight categories.

faqs.question: What BMI range is considered healthy?
faqs.answer: A BMI between 18.5 and 24.9 is typically considered normal.

faqs.question: Does BMI account for muscle mass?
faqs.answer: No, muscular people may have a high BMI despite low body fat.

faqs.question: Can I use pounds and inches?
faqs.answer: Convert values to kilograms and centimeters to use this calculator.

title: Daily Calorie Burn (Rough)
description: Estimate daily calories burned from your step count and exercise time.
intro: Provides a rough estimate of calories burned in a day using steps walked and exercise minutes.

faqs.question: How are calories from steps calculated?
faqs.answer: Each step is approximated to burn about 0.04 kcal.

faqs.question: What about exercise minutes?
faqs.answer: Every minute of exercise adds roughly 7 kcal.

faqs.question: Can I enter zero for steps or exercise?
faqs.answer: Yes, set either field to 0 if it doesn't apply.

faqs.question: How accurate is this estimate?
faqs.answer: It's a simple approximation that doesn't consider intensity or individual differences.

info: Assumes roughly 0.04 kcal per step and 7 kcal per exercise minute.
Doesn't factor in body weight, intensity, or individual metabolism.

title: Celsius to Fahrenheit
description: Convert a temperature from Celsius into Fahrenheit.
intro: This calculator converts temperatures in degrees Celsius to degrees Fahrenheit using the formula F = C × 9/5 + 32. Enter any Celsius value to see the equivalent Fahrenheit reading.

faqs.question: How is Celsius converted to Fahrenheit?
faqs.answer: Multiply the Celsius value by 9/5 and add 32.

faqs.question: Can I convert negative temperatures?
faqs.answer: Yes, the formula works for any real number.

faqs.question: Does it support decimals?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can enter decimal values.

faqs.question: How do I convert Fahrenheit to Celsius?
faqs.answer: Use the Fahrenheit to Celsius calculator or apply C = (F - 32) × 5/9.

info: Applies the precise formula F = C × 9/5 + 32, rounding results to a practical level.
Note that Celsius is the international standard, while Fahrenheit is primarily used in the United States.

title: Kilometers to Miles
description: Convert kilometers into miles.

faqs.question: Is the factor exact?
faqs.answer: We use the standard 1 km = 0.621371 miles.

info: Employs the standard factor of 1 kilometer = 0.621371 miles, with results rounded for readability.
Useful for converting travel distances or vehicle mileage from metric to imperial units.

title: Meters to Feet Converter
description: Convert meters to feet instantly.

faqs.question: How precise is this conversion?
faqs.answer: It uses the exact factor of 3.28084 feet per meter.

title: Percentage Increase
description: Get the percentage increase from an old value to a new value.
intro: Determine how much a value has grown. Enter the original and new values to see the percentage increase.

faqs.question: What if the new value is lower?
faqs.answer: The result will be negative, indicating a percentage decrease.

faqs.question: Can I use negative numbers?
faqs.answer: Yes, but interpret the result carefully depending on context.

faqs.question: Why is the result undefined when the old value is 0?
faqs.answer: Division by zero makes the percentage change impossible to compute.

faqs.question: Is percentage increase the same as growth rate?
faqs.answer: It expresses growth relative to the original value, often used as a growth rate.

title: Rule of Three Calculator
description: Find the missing value in a proportion using three known numbers.
intro: Enter A, B, and C to solve for X in the proportion A/B = C/X.

faqs.question: What is the rule of three?
faqs.answer: It solves a proportion a:b = c:x by computing x = b × c / a.

faqs.question: Can I use decimals?
faqs.answer: Yes, the calculator accepts decimal values.

faqs.question: Why must A not be zero?
faqs.answer: Division by zero is undefined, so A must be nonzero.

faqs.question: Do the inputs need units?
faqs.answer: Use consistent units for B and C so the result carries that unit.

title: Circle Area
description: Calculate the area of a circle from its radius.
intro: Determine the surface area enclosed by a circle using A = πr². Enter the radius to compute the area.

faqs.question: What formula is used?
faqs.answer: The area equals π times the radius squared.

faqs.question: Can I use the diameter instead?
faqs.answer: Yes, divide the diameter by 2 to get the radius first.

faqs.question: Which units are supported?
faqs.answer: Any length unit works; the result uses the squared version of that unit.

faqs.question: What if the radius is zero?
faqs.answer: A radius of zero yields an area of zero.

title: Download Time
description: Estimate how long a file download will take based on size and speed.
intro: This tool divides file size by connection speed to estimate the download duration. Enter the file size in megabytes and your download speed in megabits per second to get the time in seconds.

faqs.question: Why multiply by 8?
faqs.answer: There are 8 bits in a byte, so megabytes are converted to megabits.

faqs.question: Does this include network overhead?
faqs.answer: No, it assumes ideal conditions without protocol overhead.

faqs.question: Can I use gigabytes?
faqs.answer: Convert gigabytes to megabytes before entering (1 GB = 1024 MB).

faqs.question: What if my speed fluctuates?
faqs.answer: Use your average download speed for a rough estimate.

title: Centimeters to Inches Converter
description: Convert a length from centimeters to inches.
intro: Enter a length in centimeters to instantly see the equivalent in inches.

faqs.question: What is the conversion factor?
faqs.answer: One inch equals exactly 2.54 centimeters.

faqs.question: Can I convert fractional centimeters?
faqs.answer: Yes, decimals are supported.

faqs.question: Is this calculator suitable for fabric measurements?
faqs.answer: Yes, it works for any length in centimeters.

faqs.question: How do I convert inches to centimeters?
faqs.answer: Multiply inches by 2.54 or use the inches to centimeters calculator.

title: Cylinder Volume Calculator
description: Calculate the volume of a cylinder from radius and height.
intro: Compute the volume of a cylinder using πr²h. Enter the radius and height in centimeters to get the volume in cubic centimeters.

faqs.question: What formula is used?
faqs.answer: Volume equals π times the radius squared times the height.

faqs.question: Can I use different units?
faqs.answer: Yes, keep radius and height in the same units to get volume in cubic of that unit.

faqs.question: Does the calculator accept decimals?
faqs.answer: Yes, you may enter decimal measurements.

faqs.question: What happens if a value is zero?
faqs.answer: If radius or height is zero, the volume is zero.

title: Fahrenheit to Celsius Converter
description: Convert Fahrenheit temperatures to Celsius.
intro: Enter a temperature in degrees Fahrenheit to convert it to degrees Celsius.

faqs.question: How does the formula work?
faqs.answer: Subtract 32 from the Fahrenheit value and multiply by 5/9 to get Celsius.

faqs.question: Can I convert below-freezing temperatures?
faqs.answer: Yes, negative results are valid Celsius values.

faqs.question: Are decimal inputs allowed?
faqs.answer: Yes, the calculator supports decimal Fahrenheit values.

faqs.question: How do I convert Celsius back to Fahrenheit?
faqs.answer: Use the Celsius to Fahrenheit calculator or apply F = C × 9/5 + 32.

title: Storage Redundancy Overhead
description: Compute overhead percentage when storing data with redundancy.
intro: Redundant storage protects data by duplicating files, but it consumes extra capacity. This calculator compares redundant data to original data to show what percentage of your total storage is overhead.

examples.description: 10 TB data with 5 TB redundancy ⇒ 50% overhead
100 TB data with 20 TB redundancy ⇒ 20% overhead

faqs.question: What is redundancy overhead?
faqs.answer: The extra storage required for redundancy expressed as a percentage of the original data.

faqs.question: Can I use GB instead of TB?
faqs.answer: Yes. Any consistent units work; the percentage remains the same.

faqs.question: What if redundant data is zero?
faqs.answer: The overhead is 0% when no redundancy is stored.

faqs.question: Why can't data be 0?
faqs.answer: The calculation divides by the data size, so overhead is undefined if data is 0.

faqs.question: Can I use decimals?
faqs.answer: Use whole numbers; the calculator treats inputs as integers.

faqs.answer: Negative values are invalid and will not calculate.

intro: Enter your total hardware cost and expected daily net profit to find how many days it takes to break even.

faqs.answer: Include electricity costs in the daily profit for accuracy.

title: Loan Extra Payment Time Saved

$100k at 4% for 15y with $100 extra ⇒ 19 months saved

description: Convert cups of flour to grams.
intro: Quickly convert all-purpose flour from cups to grams for precise baking measurements.

faqs.question: Is this for all-purpose flour?
faqs.answer: Yes, it uses a standard 120 g per cup for all-purpose flour.

faqs.question: Do different flours weigh differently?
faqs.answer: Yes, whole wheat or other flours may have different weights.

faqs.question: Why use grams instead of cups?
faqs.answer: Weighing flour provides more consistent baking results.

disclaimer: Approximate conversion; verify critical recipes with a kitchen scale.
info: 1 US cup of all-purpose flour is roughly 120 grams.
Sifting or packing flour can change the weight.

title: Time Zone Meeting Planner
description: Convert a meeting time between two time zones.
intro: Enter a local meeting time and the UTC offsets to find the corresponding time in another time zone.

faqs.question: How do I handle half-hour offsets?
faqs.answer: Enter decimal offsets such as 5.5 for UTC+5:30.

faqs.question: Does this account for daylight saving time?
faqs.answer: No, adjust offsets manually for daylight saving changes.

faqs.question: What does the result represent?
faqs.answer: It shows the meeting hour in the participant's time zone.

disclaimer: For general planning; verify local times, especially around daylight saving transitions.
info: UTC offsets are hours ahead or behind Coordinated Universal Time.
Result is given in 24-hour format.

title: Flesch-Kincaid Readability Calculator
description: Estimate the U.S. school grade level of a text.
intro: Provide counts of words, sentences and syllables to calculate the Flesch-Kincaid grade level.

faqs.question: What does the grade level mean?
faqs.answer: It approximates the U.S. school grade needed to understand the text.

faqs.question: Can I use this for other languages?
faqs.answer: The formula was designed for English and may not suit other languages.

faqs.question: Do abbreviations affect the result?
faqs.answer: They may; ensure counts reflect actual sentence and syllable totals.

disclaimer: Readability formulas are estimates; real comprehension varies among readers.
info: Developed for U.S. Navy training materials in the 1970s.
Lower scores indicate easier-to-read text.

title: Doppler Effect Frequency Shift Calculator
description: Find the observed frequency when source or observer is moving.
intro: Enter the source frequency, velocities and speed of sound to compute the observed frequency using the Doppler effect.

examples.description: 500 Hz, observer 10 m/s, source 20 m/s ⇒ 546.44 Hz
1000 Hz, observer 0 m/s, source 30 m/s ⇒ 1095.85 Hz

faqs.question: How are directions handled?
faqs.answer: Velocities toward each other are positive; use negative values when moving apart.

faqs.question: Can I use other wave speeds?
faqs.answer: Yes, replace the speed of sound with the speed of the wave in the medium.

faqs.question: What if source velocity equals wave speed?
faqs.answer: The formula approaches infinity; ensure source speed is below wave speed.

disclaimer: Assumes constant velocity and ignores relativistic effects.
info: Named after Austrian physicist Christian Doppler.
Useful in radar, astronomy and medical imaging.

title: Color Contrast Checker
description: Calculate WCAG contrast ratio between two RGB colors.
intro: Enter RGB values for foreground and background colors to determine their contrast ratio.
expression: (function(r1,g1,b1,r2,g2,b2){function L(r,g,b){r/=255;g/=255;b/=255;function C(c){return c<=0.03928?c/12.92:((c+0.055)/1.055)**2.4;} r=C(r);g=C(g);b=C(b);return 0.2126*r+0.7152*g+0.0722*b;} const L1=L(r1,g1,b1); const L2=L(r2,g2,b2); const ratio=(Math.max(L1,L2)+0.05)/(Math.min(L1,L2)+0.05); return ratio.toFixed(2)+':1';})(r1,g1,b1,r2,g2,b2)

faqs.question: What ratio meets WCAG AA for normal text?
faqs.answer: A contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1 is recommended.

faqs.question: Do I enter hexadecimal colors?
faqs.answer: Convert hex values to RGB numbers before using the calculator.

faqs.question: Why is contrast important?
faqs.answer: Adequate contrast improves readability and accessibility for all users.

disclaimer: For basic accessibility checks; verify with full WCAG guidelines for compliance.
info: Contrast ratios range from 1:1 (no contrast) to 21:1 (maximum).
Uses relative luminance as defined by WCAG 2.1.

title: Solar Panel Savings Calculator
description: Estimate yearly electricity savings from solar panels.
intro: Calculate annual savings by combining sunlight hours, panel wattage, number of panels and electricity cost.

faqs.question: Does it account for panel efficiency?
faqs.answer: No, it assumes panels operate at their rated wattage.

faqs.question: What about installation costs?
faqs.answer: This calculator focuses only on potential energy savings.

faqs.question: Can I use local electricity rates?
faqs.answer: Yes, enter your utility's cost per kWh for personalized results.

disclaimer: Estimates only; actual savings depend on system efficiency and local conditions.
info: 1 kWh equals 1000 watt-hours.
Sun hours represent average peak sunlight per day.

title: Distance to Horizon Calculator
description: Estimate how far you can see based on your height above sea level.
intro: Enter the observer's height to approximate the distance to the horizon using Earth's curvature.

faqs.question: Does weather affect visibility?
faqs.answer: Yes, fog or haze can reduce visible distance despite the geometric horizon.

faqs.question: Is Earth's curvature assumed spherical?
faqs.answer: Yes, it uses an average Earth radius and ignores refraction.

faqs.question: Can I enter height in feet?
faqs.answer: Convert feet to meters before using the calculator.

disclaimer: Ideal geometric estimate; atmospheric refraction is not considered.
info: Formula uses Earth's mean radius of about 6,371 km.
Result gives distance to the geometric horizon in kilometers.

title: Earnings Per Share Calculator
description: Estimate earnings per share from net income, dividends, and shares outstanding.
intro: Determine a company's earnings per share by subtracting preferred dividends from net income and dividing by shares outstanding.

faqs.question: What if there are no preferred dividends?
faqs.answer: Set dividends to 0.

faqs.question: Can EPS be negative?
faqs.answer: Yes, if net income is negative.

faqs.question: Does this calculate diluted EPS?
faqs.answer: No, it uses basic shares outstanding.

disclaimer: For informational purposes; verify with financial statements.
info: EPS measures profit per share for comparing company performance.
Dividends to preferred stockholders are excluded from earnings for common shareholders.

title: 401(k) Employer Match Calculator
description: Calculate total annual 401(k) contribution including employer match.
intro: Enter your salary, contribution percentage, employer match rate, and match limit to estimate the total yearly 401(k) contribution including employer match.

examples.description: $60,000 salary, 5% employee, 50% match up to 5% ⇒ $4,500 USD
$80,000 salary, 8% employee, 100% match up to 3% ⇒ $8,800 USD

faqs.question: What if my contribution exceeds the match limit?
faqs.answer: Only the portion up to the limit is matched.

faqs.question: Does this include investment growth?
faqs.answer: No, it only sums annual contributions.

faqs.question: Are IRS contribution caps considered?
faqs.answer: No, check current IRS limits for total contributions.

disclaimer: Estimates contributions; plan rules may vary.
info: Many employers match a percentage of salary up to a specified limit.
Total contributions are subject to annual IRS caps.

title: Confidence Interval Calculator
description: Compute confidence interval for a sample mean.
intro: Enter sample mean, standard deviation, sample size and confidence level to calculate the confidence interval around the mean.

examples.description: Mean 50 units, SD 5, n 30, 95% ⇒ 48.21 to 51.79 units
Mean 120 units, SD 20, n 100, 90% ⇒ 116.71 to 123.29 units

faqs.question: Which confidence levels are supported?
faqs.answer: 90%, 95%, and 99%; other values default to 95%.

faqs.question: What if sample size is small?
faqs.answer: For n<30 consider using the t-distribution.

faqs.question: Does it handle proportions?
faqs.answer: No, it is designed for means.

disclaimer: Simplified z-based interval; not suitable for all statistical analyses.
info: Uses z-scores assuming normal distribution.
Larger samples produce narrower intervals.

title: BTU to kWh Converter
description: Convert British Thermal Units to kilowatt-hours.
intro: Enter energy in BTU to convert to kilowatt-hours.

faqs.question: What is the conversion factor?
faqs.answer: 1 BTU equals 0.00029307107 kWh.

faqs.question: Can I convert kWh to BTU?
faqs.answer: Yes, divide kWh by 0.00029307107 to get BTU.

faqs.question: Why is this useful?
faqs.answer: It helps compare heating or cooling energy in electrical terms.

disclaimer: Uses standard conversion; system efficiency not considered.
info: BTU measures heat; kWh measures electrical energy.
Commonly used to estimate HVAC energy consumption.

title: Class Rank Percentile Calculator
description: Find a student's percentile rank based on class size and position.
intro: Enter class rank (1 = top student) and total class size to compute percentile position.

faqs.question: Is rank 1 the highest?
faqs.answer: Yes, rank 1 represents the top student.

faqs.question: Can percentile exceed 100?
faqs.answer: No, percentile ranges from 0 to 100.

faqs.question: Why add 1 in the formula?
faqs.answer: It ensures the top rank maps close to the 100th percentile.

disclaimer: For academic ranking only; methods may vary by institution.
info: Percentiles show relative standing within a group.
Schools may compute percentile differently; confirm with your institution.

title: Thrust-to-Weight Ratio Calculator
description: Estimate thrust-to-weight ratio for rockets or aircraft.
intro: Divide engine thrust by vehicle weight to assess performance.

faqs.question: What does a ratio over 1 mean?
faqs.answer: The vehicle can accelerate upward.

faqs.question: Can I use pounds-force?
faqs.answer: Yes, if thrust and weight use the same units.

faqs.question: Does weight include fuel?
faqs.answer: Use the total weight at the time of measurement.

disclaimer: Ignores drag and real flight conditions.
info: High thrust-to-weight ratios are key for launch vehicles.
Ratio is dimensionless; use consistent units for thrust and weight.

title: Swimming Calories Burned Calculator
description: Estimate calories burned while swimming based on stroke, duration, and body weight.
intro: Enter your body weight, swim duration, and stroke MET value to estimate calories burned.

faqs.question: What MET should I use?
faqs.answer: Freestyle moderate ≈8, vigorous ≈10; breaststroke ≈10.

faqs.question: Does this include rest periods?
faqs.answer: No, enter active swimming time only.

faqs.question: Is weight in pounds allowed?
faqs.answer: Convert pounds to kilograms first.

disclaimer: Estimates only; actual burn varies with technique and efficiency.
info: MET values come from the Compendium of Physical Activities.
Calories burned depend on intensity and individual metabolism.

title: Glycemic Load Calculator
description: Calculate glycemic load using carbohydrate grams and glycemic index.
intro: Multiply the carbohydrate content of a serving by its glycemic index and divide by 100 to get glycemic load.

faqs.question: What is considered low GL?
faqs.answer: Less than 10 is low, 10–20 is medium, and over 20 is high.

faqs.question: Can GI exceed 100?
faqs.answer: No, the glycemic index scale runs from 0 to 100.

faqs.question: Does fiber affect GL?
faqs.answer: Yes, GL typically uses net carbs after subtracting fiber.

disclaimer: For dietary reference; consult healthcare providers for medical advice.
info: Glycemic load reflects both quality and quantity of carbohydrates.
Helps manage blood sugar impact of meals.

title: Airline Miles Value Calculator
description: Estimate the monetary value of airline miles based on trip cost and miles required.
intro: Compare the cash fare to required miles and fees to estimate value per mile.

faqs.question: Why subtract fees?
faqs.answer: Fees reduce the value of miles redeemed.

faqs.question: What value is considered good?
faqs.answer: Typical mile values range from 1¢ to 2¢ each.

faqs.question: Does this include miles earned on cash tickets?
faqs.answer: No, it compares redemption value only.

disclaimer: Estimates vary by route and award availability.
info: Helps decide whether to pay cash or use miles for a trip.
Award charts and promotions can change mile value.

title: Customer Retention Rate Calculator
description: Compute the percentage of customers retained over a period.
intro: Enter number of customers at the start and end of a period plus new customers acquired to calculate retention rate.

faqs.question: Why subtract new customers?
faqs.answer: To measure how many original customers stayed.

faqs.question: Can retention rate exceed 100%?
faqs.answer: No; values above 100 indicate data errors.

faqs.question: What period should I use?
faqs.answer: Any consistent timeframe such as a month or year.

disclaimer: Simplified metric; complex businesses may need cohort analysis.
info: Retention rate highlights customer loyalty and business stability.
Pair with churn rate for a complete view of customer dynamics.

title: Sump Pump Size Calculator
description: Estimate required sump pump capacity based on pit volume and desired drainage time.
intro: Divide sump pit volume by the time in minutes you want it drained to determine pump capacity.

faqs.question: Does this account for pump efficiency?
faqs.answer: No, choose a pump with slightly higher capacity.

faqs.question: Can I use liters?
faqs.answer: Convert liters to gallons before using the calculator.

faqs.question: What if the pit refills continuously?
faqs.answer: Higher inflow may require a more powerful or backup pump.

disclaimer: Basic sizing; consult a professional for high-risk areas.
info: Typical household sump pumps range from 20–60 gallons per minute.
Consider power outages and backup options for critical installations.

title: Hash Collision Probability Calculator
description: Estimate probability of at least one hash collision using the birthday paradox.
intro: Using the birthday paradox approximation, estimate the chance that at least two hashes collide for a given number of hashes and hash size.

faqs.question: Why use the birthday paradox?
faqs.answer: It approximates collision probability for large sample spaces.

faqs.question: Does increasing hash size reduce collisions?
faqs.answer: Yes, more bits drastically lower collision risk.

faqs.question: Is the formula exact?
faqs.answer: It's an approximation assuming uniform hash distribution.

disclaimer: Assumes random hashes; real implementations may differ.
info: Probability grows roughly with the square of the number of hashes.
Cryptographic algorithms often use 256-bit hashes to minimize collisions.

title: Decibel to Power Percentage Calculator
description: Convert decibel values to linear power percentages.
intro: This tool converts a decibel (dB) value into a corresponding power percentage relative to the reference level. Enter a dB value to see the equivalent percent of power.

faqs.question: What does a negative dB value mean?
faqs.answer: It indicates power lower than the reference level.

faqs.question: Is 0 dB equal to 100%?
faqs.answer: Yes, 0 dB corresponds to the reference power.

faqs.question: Can this calculator handle fractional dB values?
faqs.answer: Yes, decimals are supported for precise conversions.

disclaimer: Verify critical audio or RF measurements with calibrated equipment.
info: Uses formula 10^(dB/10)*100 to convert decibels to power percentage.
Common in audio engineering and signal processing.

title: Next Full Moon Calculator
description: Estimate days until the next full moon from a given date.
intro: This calculator approximates the number of days until the next full moon. Enter a date to get an estimate based on the average lunar cycle.
expression: (() => { const d=Date.UTC(year,month-1,day)/86400000; const known=Date.UTC(2024,0,25)/86400000; const cycle=29.530588853; return Math.ceil((cycle - ((d - known) % cycle)) % cycle); })()

faqs.question: How accurate is this calculator?
faqs.answer: It uses an average lunar cycle of 29.53 days, so results are approximate.

faqs.question: What time zone is used?
faqs.answer: Dates are handled in UTC for simplicity.

faqs.question: Can I enter past dates?
faqs.answer: Yes, it finds the next full moon after the given date.

disclaimer: Approximate astronomical calculation; consult official lunar tables for precise times.
info: The synodic month averages 29.530588853 days.
Full moon dates shift slightly due to orbital variations.

title: CEFR Study Hours Estimator
description: Estimate hours needed to reach a target CEFR level.
intro: Estimate additional study hours required to progress from your current CEFR language level to a target level. Use 0 for no level, 1 for A1 up to 6 for C2.

faqs.question: What do the numeric levels mean?
faqs.answer: Use 1 for A1 up to 6 for C2; 0 indicates no prior study.

faqs.question: Are these hours exact?
faqs.answer: No, they are estimates based on common teaching guidelines.

faqs.question: Does the calculator account for language difficulty?
faqs.answer: No, it uses general averages regardless of language.

disclaimer: For study planning only; adjust based on personal progress.
info: Estimates derived from CEFR self-study hour ranges.
Actual time needed varies with prior knowledge and exposure.

title: Dividend Reinvestment Calculator
description: Project investment value when dividends are reinvested.
intro: Estimate the future value of an investment when dividends are reinvested and the stock price grows annually. Enter initial investment, dividend yield, growth rate, and years.

examples.description: $5,000 at 3% yield and 2% growth for 10 years ⇒ $8,144.47
$2,000 at 3% yield and 4% growth for 5 years ⇒ $2,805.10

faqs.question: Does the calculator include additional contributions?
faqs.answer: No, it assumes only the initial investment with reinvested dividends.

faqs.question: Are taxes considered?
faqs.answer: No, taxes and fees are excluded.

faqs.question: Can yields and growth rates change over time?
faqs.answer: This tool assumes constant annual rates.

disclaimer: Not investment advice; consult a financial professional.
info: Assumes dividends and growth compound annually.
Useful for comparing dividend reinvestment strategies.

title: Sleep Efficiency Calculator
description: Measure the percentage of time in bed spent asleep.
intro: Calculate sleep efficiency by comparing actual sleep time to total time spent in bed. Enter hours in bed and hours slept.

faqs.question: What is a good sleep efficiency?
faqs.answer: Typically above 85% is considered healthy.

faqs.question: Can efficiency exceed 100%?
faqs.answer: No, time asleep cannot exceed time in bed.

faqs.question: Should I track naps separately?
faqs.answer: This calculator focuses on one sleep session; track naps separately.

disclaimer: For educational purposes; consult a sleep specialist for health concerns.
info: Sleep efficiency = (time asleep / time in bed) × 100.
Helpful for evaluating sleep quality.

title: Grass Seed Coverage Calculator
description: Estimate how much grass seed you need for a given area.
intro: Determine the amount of grass seed required by dividing lawn area by the coverage rate provided on the seed bag.

faqs.question: What if my area is irregular?
faqs.answer: Measure as accurately as possible or break it into smaller sections.

faqs.question: Does seed type affect coverage?
faqs.answer: Yes, different seeds have different recommended rates.

faqs.question: Should I buy extra seed?
faqs.answer: It's wise to buy slightly more to account for losses.

disclaimer: Estimates only; consult product guidelines for precise coverage.
info: Most seed bags list coverage in m² per kg.
Include extra for overseeding or patch repairs.

title: Travel Insurance Cost Estimator
description: Approximate travel insurance premium based on trip details.
intro: Get a rough estimate of travel insurance cost using trip price, traveler age, and trip length. This is a simplified model for planning purposes.

faqs.question: Does this include medical coverage specifics?
faqs.answer: No, it's a general estimate and doesn't factor policy details.

faqs.question: Why does age affect cost?
faqs.answer: Insurers often charge higher premiums for older travelers.

faqs.question: Are high-risk activities covered?
faqs.answer: This estimator doesn't account for special activities; check policy terms.

disclaimer: Rough estimate only; obtain quotes from insurance providers for actual premiums.
info: Real insurers consider destination, coverage limits, and medical history.
Premiums typically range between 4%–10% of trip cost.

title: Prime Factorization Calculator

intro: Enter an integer to see its prime factors expressed in a multiplication sequence.

faqs.question: What numbers can I factor?
faqs.answer: Enter positive integers up to JavaScript's safe limit.

faqs.question: Does the order of factors matter?
faqs.answer: The calculator lists prime factors in ascending order.

faqs.question: Is 1 considered a prime factor?
faqs.answer: No, 1 is not prime and is not included.

disclaimer: Educational tool; verify large factorizations with specialized software.
info: Prime factorization expresses a number as a product of prime numbers.
Useful for simplifying fractions and solving number theory problems.

title: BNPL APR Calculator
description: Convert buy now, pay later plans to an equivalent APR.
intro: Estimate the annual percentage rate of a BNPL plan by comparing total fees to the purchase amount and repayment term.

faqs.question: Does this include late fees?
faqs.answer: No, only the specified fees are included.

faqs.question: Why convert BNPL to APR?
faqs.answer: It helps compare BNPL plans with traditional credit options.

faqs.question: What if there are no fees?
faqs.answer: The APR will be 0%, indicating a zero-cost plan.

disclaimer: Approximate APR; lender calculations may differ.
info: Assumes equal payments and no interest beyond fees.
APR helps compare financing options on a yearly basis.

title: Radiocarbon Dating Calculator
description: Estimate the age of organic material from remaining carbon-14.
intro: Compute the approximate age of an organic sample using the remaining percentage of carbon-14 compared to a modern reference.

faqs.question: What half-life is assumed?
faqs.answer: The calculation uses a mean life of 8,033 years (half-life ≈ 5,730 years).

faqs.question: Does contamination affect results?
faqs.answer: Yes, contamination can skew the carbon-14 percentage.

faqs.question: Is radiocarbon dating precise?
faqs.answer: It provides an estimate; calibration improves accuracy.

disclaimer: For archaeological estimation only; laboratory analysis required for precise dating.
info: Based on exponential decay N_t/N_0 = e^{-t/8033}.
Valid for samples up to about 50,000 years old.

title: USB Voltage Drop Calculator
description: Estimate voltage drop across a USB cable.
intro: Calculate the expected voltage drop along a USB cable given its length, current draw, and wire gauge.
expression: (() => { const r = awg==28?0.214:awg==24?0.0842:0.1339; return current * r * length * 2; })()

faqs.question: Why multiply by two for length?
faqs.answer: Current travels to the device and back, doubling the resistance.

faqs.question: What if my gauge is different?
faqs.answer: Use the closest AWG value; results are approximate.

faqs.question: Can voltage drop cause charging issues?
faqs.answer: Yes, excessive drop can prevent devices from receiving sufficient power.

disclaimer: Approximate calculation; check manufacturer specs for exact values.
info: Based on ohmic resistance per conductor.
USB standards recommend keeping drop below 0.25 V for reliable operation.

title: A/B Test Sample Size Calculator
description: Estimate required visitors per variant for an A/B test.
intro: Determine the sample size needed for an A/B test using baseline conversion rate and minimum detectable effect. Assumes 95% confidence and 80% power.
expression: (() => { const b=base/100; const m=(base+mde)/100; const p=(b+m)/2; return Math.ceil(((1.96*Math.sqrt(2*p*(1-p)) + 0.84*Math.sqrt(b*(1-b)+m*(1-m)))**2)/((m-b)**2)); })()

faqs.question: What confidence level does this use?
faqs.answer: It assumes a 95% confidence level.

faqs.question: What statistical power is assumed?
faqs.answer: The calculation uses 80% power.

faqs.question: Can I change confidence or power?
faqs.answer: This basic version fixes them; use advanced tools for custom values.

disclaimer: For planning A/B tests; consult a statistician for critical experiments.
info: Formula based on two-proportion z-test.
Sample size applies to each variant separately.
